com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.eval

Class TestTicket1007

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • junit.framework.TestCase2
          • com.bigdata.bop.engine.AbstractQueryEngineTestCase
            • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.AbstractASTEvaluationTestCase
              • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.eval.AbstractDataAndSPARQLTestCase
                • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.eval.AbstractDataDrivenSPARQLTestCase
                  • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.eval.TestTicket1007
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestTicket1007
extends AbstractDataDrivenSPARQLTestCase
    Various tests covering different constellations where values are constructed using BIND and reused in other parts of the query, such as - testing inlined vs. non-inlined configuration - using BIND prior to vs. after joining/filtering the variable - BINDing to values that are in the dictionary vs. BINDing to values that are not in the dictionary
    Author:
    Michael Schmidt
    See Also:
    Ticket 1007: Using bound variables to refer to a graph

    • Method Detail

      • test_ticket_1007

        public void test_ticket_1007()
                      throws Exception
        Original query as defined in bug report, reusing a URI constructed in a BIND clause in a join: PREFIX : SELECT * WHERE { GRAPH { :aProperty ?literal . BIND (URI(CONCAT("http://www.interition.net/graphs/",?literal)) AS ?graph) . } GRAPH ?graph { ?s ?p ?o . } } Note: originally this query failed.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • test_ticket_1007b

        public void test_ticket_1007b()
                       throws Exception
        Modified query with join "on top", enforced through outer VALUES clause. PREFIX : SELECT * WHERE { GRAPH { :aProperty ?literal . BIND (URI(CONCAT("http://www.interition.net/graphs/",?literal)) AS ?graph) . } } VALUES ?graph { }
        Throws:
        Exception

      • test_ticket_1007_subquery

        public void test_ticket_1007_subquery()
                               throws Exception
        Test problems with BIND inside and reuse of variable outside of subquery. SELECT DISTINCT * { { SELECT ?annotatedSource WHERE { hint:SubQuery hint:runOnce true . ?s ?p ?o . FILTER(strstarts(?o,"annotated")) BIND(concat(substr(?o,1,9),"Source") as ?annotatedSource) } } ?ss ?pp ?annotatedSource } LIMIT 20
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        here for more details
